de.dennis_kempf.squidward

Class ImmutableAutomaton

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dennis_kempf.squidward.ImmutableAutomaton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Automaton

    public class ImmutableAutomaton
extends java.lang.Object
implements Automaton
    Implementation of Automaton whose sets of states and transitions are immutable. This class is not truly immutable as the current state and the enabled flag can change. TODO: Implement this class in a thread safe manner

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ImmutableAutomaton.Builder
      Builder for construction of an ImmutableAutomaton.

    • Method Detail

      • getInitialState

        public State getInitialState()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Returns the initial state of the automaton. When Automaton.enable() is first called, this will be the new state and its entry action will be invoked.
        Specified by:
        getInitialState in interface Automaton
        Returns:
        initial state

      • getCurrentState

        public java.util.Optional<State> getCurrentState()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Returns the current state of the automaton. The current state may be undefined (optional will be empty) if the automaton has not been enabled yet or the automaton is currently executing a transition.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentState in interface Automaton
        Returns:
        current state

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Returns whether the automaton has been enabled. This method may return true, even if the initial state's entry action has not been executed yet.
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Automaton
        Returns:
        true, if enabled, otherwise false

      • enable

        public void enable()
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Enables the automaton. The current state will be set to the initial state and the initial state's entry action will be queued for execution. This method may only be called, if the automaton has not been enabled yet.
        Specified by:
        enable in interface Automaton

      • post

        public void post(java.lang.Object event)
        Description copied from interface: Automaton
        Adds the provided event to the processing queue. This method may only be called once the automaton has been enabled. TODO: Add documentation on transition mechanism
        Specified by:
        post in interface Automaton
        Parameters:
        event - non-null
